有咁需要休息咩
都唔係投左好多球

I remember seeing Tigers vs White Sox live at a stadium where I placed a bet on the result of the match. I bet one million two hundred forty five thousand five hundred yen on Tigers. I remember the two ladies beside me were also putting bets on which team would win the championship. I said to them "I bet you twenty seven yen that Tigers will win" and it really happened. It was unforgettable. Though baseball isn't very popular in hong kong, it's being offset by an increase in the marketing and promotin of the sport. After the match I dined at a ramen restaurant nearby. I remember the table was sticky maybe because the staff forgot to wipe it up so I asked them to wipe it up. Later I spilt a bowl of miso soup all over the table and my trousers so I had to wipe up the spilled soup. I had a friendly chat with a lady sitting at a nearby table who told me once upon a time an entire village was wiped out by a Super gigantic earthquake. Fascinating. When I finished my meal I wiped my mouth on my sleeves lol and tissues. There's an elegant cafe nearby of which the interior and the exterior are artistically and exquisitely designed. My friend spilt a cappuccino there the other day so he ended up wiping this mess up lol. I enjoy drinking coffee and chatting with the baristas there so much that I occasionally make it worth their while.

太空人被好多個唔同既source指證17年有偷sign

https://theathletic.com/1363451/2019/11/12/the-astros-stole-signs-electronically-in-2017-part-of-a-much-broader-issue-for-major-league-baseball/

Article does say that sign stealing is believed to be everywhere, both analog and advanced tech. Athletic has some sources from 2017 saying that the Astros stole signs using cameras. [Sources include former pitcher Mike Fiers. Danny Farquhar is quoted as having recognized that the Astros were stealing signs when he was on the mound facing the Astros].

Looks like they don't have any info on whether other teams have been "caught" or not, just the Astros.

Which means we're not sure if this does happen throughout MLB, or if people just generally already dislike the Astros and so are willing to talk about them more.

Astros' system in 2017 is alleged to be a camera placed in center field, aimed at the catcher.

Camera feed was linked to a monitor in the tunnel between the dugout and clubhouse. Astros employees/players would look at the feed during games.

If deciphered, the Astros would allegedly then bang on a trash can in the dugout. Sound would carry to the field, tipping off for an offspeed. This wouldn't be done at away games, obviously.

Sources are split on whether this happened in the postseason. Some said it did, some said it didn't. Noise level during the WS also may have rendered this ineffective.

Fiers says that the system wasn't used by every player on the team.

Source says that an Astro player once complained about the system not working on a particular day.

Source claims that a player said that they were looking forward to getting back home so the system could be used.

Source claims that, during a game, the Astros became concerned that they'd be caught, so the screen was hidden mid-game.

Astros apparently believed that they're justified because other teams were probably doing stuff too.

replies.msg:
其實睇棒球同睇足球係完全唔同

棒球場館大，有周邊行，轉場時間又多，節奏慢。適合同朋友/屋企人一齊去睇，邊吹水邊睇。
一場3個幾鐘但有4分1時間係換邊，換投手熱身。
每棒中間既停頓時間長，甚至每球中間都有幾十秒時間，由打者係框外思考完入框，到投手睇暗號set-up

所以你冇可能3個幾鐘都focus係場波上面

所以好多人入場就好似tvb咁慣性收視當同朋友去聚下，不過佢地唔係去酒吧係去球場咁解
白襪今年個陣值得期待一下

Max Fried from Atlantic Braves will be giving a birthday party next week but alas I can't make it as I got work to do. When he invited me at first I said "I'll see" He's making the most elaborate preparations for the party. My cousin asked him "how are the preparations for the birthday party going?" Sarah is assisting with the preparations for the party. John is also assisting in making the party preparations. They're sharing the preparation between themselves so it isn't too much work. Happy birthday Max Fried. I'm sure your fans and friends will join me in wishing you a very happy birthday. Last year he got a king size bed frame and mattress for my birthday. I remember I said "I can't believe you got me a king size bed frame and mattress" They didn't come cheap. Amy has accepted a commission to write an article on Picasso for an art magazine. She's doing research in preparation for the article. Her boyfriend is assisting in the preparation of the research as well. Amy's favourite MLB team Atlantic Braves will be playing in against Arizona Diamondbacks in May in the playoff season. Matches like this require adequate preparation. The poster and the promo video for the playoff games are in preparation. The players in Atlantic Braves are doing careful preparation for the playoff season as they didn't perform well in the last five weeks because they did little preparation. The players in Arizona Diamondbacks didn't seem to have done much preparation in the last three games as well. They almost lost them so this time they're doing meticulous preparation for it including stealing, shooting and cardio training. Training five hours a day is ideal preparation for the playoff season. You cannot play against a high level team without proper preparation. My friend Paul is making preparations for his ski trip to Fukuoka. He's also making preparations to meet his favourite band X Japan in Hiroshima. So he's preoccupied with these preparations. Preparations are being made for next month's ski festival in Fukuoka. The organisations who organise it have announced that preparations for the ski festival are under way. About seventy one percent of the earth's surface is covered by water. On mars, twenty percent of the mars' atmosphere is covered with carbon dioxide while ten percent of the atmosphere is covered by carbon monoxide. Max Fried's new chairs are covered by plastic sheeting. His new sofa is covered with protective plastic wrappings. For Tokyo a dazzling sun has been forecast for the whole month. In Kyoto there's been a long spell of dry hot weather whereas in Osaka there's been a long spell of wet cold weather. In Hiroshima the weather forecast is for a hot and sunny day and a warm and breezy night, just right for swimming. In Hong Kong the weather forecast is for sunny spells and scattered showers all week. For Fukuoka heavy rain and scattered sleet showers have been forecast while for Kagoshima light snowfalls and light rainfall have been predicted just right for skiing. For Miyazaki a sunny and breezy day has been predicted just right for sailing whereas for Nagasaki hail showers and heavy snowfalls have been forecast. In Okinawa, the weather forecast said it was going to be hot and sunny today. It also stated that there would be dry sunny spells and drizzle tomorrow. Of course sleet showers and snow showers are much better than thundery showers and wintry showers. In Hokkaido we had fog and drizzle earlier but now it's sunny. Yesterday I forgot my umbrella and raincoat so I got caught in a rain shower while touring the tourist attractions there and a hail shower on my way to the hotel. In Tokyo we had a snow shower and light rainfall earlier but now it's sleeting.

I remember seeing a baseball championship at Tokyo Dome Stadium where I had a bet on the outcome of the match. I remember the two guys beside me were placing bets on which team would win the championship. I said to them "I bet you one hundred nine thousand nine hundred dollars that Kyoto team will win" and it really happened. It was unforgettable. Though baseball isn't very popular in Hong kong it's being offset by an increase in the promotion and marketing of the sport. After the match I fined in a nearby ramen restaurant named Ramen Menya. I remember the table was sticky maybe because the staff forgot to wipe it up so I told them to wipe it up. Later I spilt a bowl of miso soup all over the table and on my trousers so I had to wipe the spilled soup up. I had a friendly chat with a lady sitting at a nearby table who told me that ince upon a time a whole village was.wiped out by a catastrophic earthquake which was fascinating to hear. When I finished my bowl of ramen i wiped my mouth on my sleeve lol and a tissue. i heartily recommend you dine in this restaurant. They have a range of broths to please sophisticated palates including chicken broth, pork bone broth, fish broth, shrimp broth and spicy broth. The slucy broth is tone down to suit the palates of the tourists sk you don't have to worry about it being too spicy. Of course they too serve food adapted to their own palate. The richness of broths is outstanding which can tempt demanding palates. The noodle texture is perfect that will please the most refined palate. I thoroughly recommend dining in this restaurant. There's an elegant cafe nearby of which the interior and the exterior are artistically and exquisitely designed. My friend Naoki spilled his cappuccino all over his work down his tie and on his shirt the other day so he had to wipe up this mess lol. I enjoy drinking coffee and chatting with the baristas there so much that I occasionally make it worth their while. Naoki makes it worth the baristas' while every time he's there.
